The carrier has suspended those involved and initiated an internal probe.

items.title: Carlyle Sells Debt of Roomba Maker as Bankruptcy Risks Loom
items.summary: Carlyle Group Inc. sold a troubled loan it provided to iRobot Corp. less than three years ago as the maker of Roomba vacuum cleaners is trying to stave off a potential bankruptcy filing.

items.title: Shein, Temu face fresh heat as Senator demands federal probe into IP theft, counterfeit concerns
items.summary: US Republican senator calls for DOJ and Homeland Security to investigate Shein, Temu for counterfeiting

items.title: Fed’s Bowman Says Bank Regulators Working on Stablecoin Rules
items.summary: The Federal Reserve’s top bank cop plans to tell House lawmakers Tuesday that she will work to establish new rules for banks and stablecoins, as regulators seek to ensure healthy competition between Wall Street, fintechs and crypto firms.

items.title: AI Data Center Firm Iren Seeks $2 Billion in Convertible Bonds
items.summary: Iren Ltd., a data center firm focused on artificial intelligence and high-performance computing, is seeking to raise $2 billion across two convertible bond issues.

items.title: Layoffs sparked by Trump tariffs—Canadian steel maker Algoma to slash 1,000 jobs, roughly 40% of its staff
items.summary: The news comes on the back of the Trump administration's decision to impose 50% tariffs on foreign steel, which Algoma said had severely hit its ability to access the market across the border.

items.title: ESR acquires 60 acres in Pune for 1.35 million sq ft industrial park development
items.summary: ESR is investing Rs 650 crore to develop a 1.35 million sq ft industrial and logistics park in Pune's Talegaon, spanning 60 acres. This move accelerates their India growth strategy, aiming to serve key sectors like automotive and e-commerce. The park's strategic location and modern infrastructure underscore Maharashtra's industrial potential and ESR's commitment to advancing western India's economic growth.

items.title: Padmaja Reddy backs away from microfin, goes for gold
items.summary: Microlending veteran Padmaja Reddy is exiting unsecured business by fiscal end to focus on gold loans, transitioning her firm Keertana Finserv to a 94% secured portfolio. Citing a "structural crisis" in microfinance, Reddy aims for Keertana to be a fully secured lender with gold loans comprising 95% of its assets under management by FY25.

items.title: Silver Price Today (Dec 1): MCX futures Rs 2 shy of unprecedented Rs 1.83 lakh mark—10 things to know
items.summary: Silver Price Today: MCX silver futures (December 5) climbed by as much as Rs 6,862, or 4.0 per cent, to Rs 1,78,499 in the evening session on Monday.

items.title: Silver rallies ₹10,000 on supply crunch, US rate cut hopes
items.summary: Silver prices surged by ₹10,000 to ₹1.74 lakh per kg, driven by a supply squeeze, a weaker dollar, and anticipated US rate cuts. This rally follows a significant increase over the past year, with investment demand projected to rise. Experts foresee continued supply deficits and further price appreciation for the white metal.

items.title: Maruti, Tata clash over small-car concessions in new CAFE norms
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors are at odds over new fuel efficiency rules for small cars. Maruti Suzuki advocates for concessions, citing global practices and affordability for common citizens. Tata Motors opposes any special treatment, emphasizing safety and the original intent of the norms. The debate centers on upcoming CAFE 3 regulations set to take effect in April 2027.

items.title: Expand footwear business to boost exports further: President Murmu
items.summary: President Droupadi Murmu stated India must expand its footwear business to boost exports.  She highlighted significant opportunities in the fast-growing sports and non-leather sectors.  The commerce and industry ministry is supporting investments in this area.  India's footwear exports reached over $2.5 billion in FY25.

items.title: Petrol sales slow in November while Diesel, ATF, LPG sales pick up speed
items.summary: Fuel demand trends shifted in November. Petrol sales growth decelerated compared to earlier months. Conversely, diesel consumption saw a significant acceleration. Aviation fuel demand also picked up pace. Liquefied petroleum gas, essential for cooking, continued its steady growth. These changes mark a reversal of the patterns observed throughout the year.

items.title: Power consumption down 0.8% in November
items.summary: India's power consumption saw a dip in November. This marks the second month in a row with reduced demand. Favourable weather conditions are the main reason for this trend. Experts point to cooler temperatures reducing the need for cooling. The India Meteorological Department noted weather impacts across several regions.

items.title: Parliament Winter Session: Finance Minister Sitharaman moves two bills for new cess on tobacco and other 'sin goods'
items.summary: New bills have been introduced to change taxes on tobacco and pan masala. The Central Excise Amendment Bill will levy excise duty on tobacco products. The Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, will apply to pan masala and other notified goods. Revenue from tobacco excise will be shared with states.

items.title: Ministries split on drug data exclusivity
items.summary: Government ministries are in talks over drug data protection rules. This issue involves domestic drug makers, global pharma giants, and patient advocates. Discussions are ongoing to find a balance. The outcome could impact access to affordable medicines for Indian patients. Investment deals are also linked to this decision. A final decision is pending.

items.title: Cough syrup row puts regulators on overdrive to test pharma products
items.summary: Indian drug companies are significantly increasing product testing. This surge follows strict government rules and joint inspections by regulators. The focus is on ensuring quality after recent contamination issues. Testing volumes have jumped dramatically. Companies are investing in specialized equipment to detect toxic substances. This heightened vigilance aims to safeguard public health and maintain the integrity of India's pharmaceutical industry.

items.title: Starbucks to pay about $35M to NYC workers to settle claims it violated labor law
items.summary: Starbucks to pay about $35M to NYC workers to settle claims it violated labor law

items.title: HSBC PMI: Manufacturing activity at nine-month low
items.summary: India's manufacturing sector saw a slowdown in November, reaching a nine-month low. This easing was attributed to US tariffs impacting sales and production. Festive season demand also contributed to the dip. While international sales remained strong, overall growth momentum weakened. New orders and output experienced a decline, reflecting tough market conditions and increased competition. Business optimism has also fallen.

items.title: November GST mop-up grows slowest in fiscal due to rates revamp
items.summary: India's Goods and Services Tax collection reached ₹1.70 lakh crore in November. This marks a modest 0.7% rise year-on-year. Officials state the growth pace exceeded expectations. The numbers reflect the initial full-month trend after GST rate adjustments. Experts believe consumption growth is offsetting some shortfalls. The government will monitor collections closely.

items.title: India's Industrial output at 14-month low in October
items.summary: India's industrial production saw a significant slowdown in October, dropping to a 14-month low of 0.4 percent. This decline follows a boost from the Goods and Services Tax in September. Factors contributing to the dip include fewer working days due to festivals and the impact of US tariffs. Manufacturing output eased, while mining and electricity also experienced a fall.

items.title: Cautious optimism: On India and growth
items.summary: India’s challenge is to maintain the growth momentum

items.title: Zee announces more layoffs as business takes a hit after failed Sony merger
items.summary: Sources said the latest round of downsizing is a continuation of the rationalisation programme initiated in April 2024 to streamline operations and align the organisation with updated business priorities following the collapse of the merger deal with Sony Pictures Networks India.

items.title: Geopolitical shifts, economic volatility forcing government CIOs to rapidly adjust priorities for 2026: Gartner
items.summary: The Stamford-based analyst firm reveals high expectations for both AI and other key technologies as government leaders focus on building a more productive workforce next year. Global public sector CIOs (excluding U.S) are reassessing vendor relationships amid global uncertainty. geopolitical tensions, digital sovereignty concerns

items.title: Govt does not direct LIC investments: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified the government's non-interference in Life Insurance Corporation's investment choices. She affirmed that LIC makes its own decisions, adhering to strict regulations. Investments are overseen by auditors and the IRDAI. LIC's current holdings in Adani Group companies stand at ₹48,284 crore. This highlights LIC's independent investment approach.

items.summary: The Coal Ministry estimates this would help in early operationalisation of the block

items.title: Steel panel meets companies on import substitution of high-value products
items.summary: In a bid to bolster local industry, a parliamentary committee is advocating for the domestic production of essential steel components. Leading manufacturers gathered to strategize on replacing imports of premium materials essential for transformers and automotive manufacturing. The emphasis is on fostering independence within these vital sectors.

items.title: Ministry of Tourism enters into MoU with Netflix to promote tourism destinations globally: Govt
items.summary: India's Ministry of Tourism is collaborating with Netflix to showcase the nation's diverse travel spots worldwide. This partnership aims to highlight natural landscapes, cultural heritage, and historical sites through captivating visual narratives. The initiative also supports rural homestays, boosting local economies. A revamped digital platform offers personalized travel experiences and seamless booking options for visitors.

items.title: Maruti strikes back at rivals as small car debate intensifies
items.summary: Maruti’s leadership said the company remains committed to reviving the small-car segment even as it expands its SUV lineup.

items.title: RBI governor releases five-year national financial inclusion strategy
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has launched a new five-year plan to boost financial inclusion. This strategy focuses on improving access and usage of financial services for everyone. It includes specific goals for women and vulnerable groups. The plan aims to ensure financial safety and security for households and small businesses.

items.title: Flame University launches India Districts programme
items.summary: Flame University has launched its Districts Project, a digital portal aiming to deepen understanding of India's districts. The project, which began with Maharashtra, integrates cultural narratives and developmental data, empowering researchers, policymakers, and citizens.  This initiative seeks to foster inclusive and context-aware governance by providing granular, participatory insights into local realities.

items.title: LIC appoints Ramakrishnan Chander as Managing Director
items.summary: Ramakrishnan Chander has been appointed as the new Managing Director of the Life Insurance Corporation of India, effective December 1. Chander, who joined the corporation in 1990, brings 35 years of experience in marketing and administration, including leading its International Operations. He previously served as Executive Director (Investment – Front Office) & Chief Investment Officer.

items.title: Bilateral trade settlement in local currencies in textiles, chemicals, metals to aid intra-APAC trade
items.summary: Asia Pacific economies are urged to boost local currency trade invoicing for goods like textiles and metals, potentially extending to services and finance. India Exim Bank highlights the need for interoperable digital systems and payment networks to facilitate seamless cross-border settlements. Regional cooperation and modernized infrastructure are key to enhancing trade efficiency and resilience.

items.title: OpenAI acquires stake in Thrive Holdings, seeks to boost AI adoption in business services
items.summary: OpenAI plans to acquire a stake in Thrive Holdings to promote AI adoption in businesses, focusing on accounting and IT services.&nbsp;

items.title: India’s GDP data robust, new series in February
items.summary: Officials said extensive data inputs with around 700 granular indicators are used for the quarterly estimates.

items.title: Banks need T20 energy and Test resilience, says RBI Deputy Governor
items.summary: Speaking at a Standard Chartered Bank event, he stressed that governance and risk management must be central to strategy, not back-office tasks

items.title: India’s current account gap narrows in Q2 on higher services exports, remittances
items.summary: India's current account deficit significantly eased to $12.3 billion in Q2 FY24, primarily driven by robust services exports and remittances. This improvement contrasts with a wider deficit in the previous quarter and a substantial decline in foreign exchange reserves on a balance of payments basis.

items.title: NCLT asks Brookfield to renew performance guarantee for IL&FS HQ
items.summary: The NCLT Mumbai has ordered Brookfield Asset Management to renew its performance guarantee for IL&FS' headquarters within 30 days, preventing bid disqualification. Brookfield emerged as the highest bidder at Rs 1,080 crore in March 2022. The tribunal ruled the Letter of Intent a concluded contract, despite IL&FS' revaluation and request for a revised offer.

items.title: Complaints against PSU banks fell, pvt banks rise in FY25, RBI data shows
items.summary: Private sector banks saw their share of complaints rise to 37.53% in 2024-25, surpassing public sector banks. The RBI received 2.96 lakh complaints, with loans and advances, credit cards, and deposit accounts being the top issues. The ombudsman resolved 2.90 lakh complaints, with over 62% deemed maintainable.

items.summary: Most of the top auto companies reported over 20% growth YoY indicating robust performance

This growth reflects a positive trend in the first half of the fiscal year. Key sectors like computer software and hardware, services, and trading attracted substantial investments. Maharashtra led the states in receiving the highest FDI.

items.title: CARE Ratings reaffirms Tata Chemicals amid market challenges
items.summary: These ratings underscore Tata Chemicals' strong financial flexibility and refinancing capabilities, supported by Tata Sons, which holds a substantial stake in the company.

items.title: Organic food exports: NE focus, cereals & millets drive growth
items.summary: India aims to achieve $2 billion in organic food exports by 2030, with current exports reaching $665 million in 2024-25. The nation's organic production has surged to 46.99 lakh tonnes, driven by a 15% CAGR in cultivation area. The first Northeast India Organic Week is underway to boost regional organic potential.

items.summary: Nvidia Corp invests $2 billion in Synopsys stock as part of an engineering partnership. This investment represents 2.6% of Synopsys’ shares and aims to enhance AI and accelerated computing.

items.title: RBI MPC Meet 2025: Date, time, and where to watch Governor Sanjay Malhotra’s policy statement
items.summary: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee meets amid strong economic growth and record low inflation. Governor Sanjay Malhotra leads the panel, which is considering a repo rate cut. Markets are divided on whether the key rate will be lowered from 5.5% or held steady.

items.title: 62% of area under Indian rabi crops covered so far as wheat coverage gains 17%
items.summary: Overall acreage of all crops up 10% as acreage of oilseeds, nutri-cereals and pulses also rises

items.summary: Prior to being promoted as ED, Janakiraman was serving as Chief General Manager-in-Charge, Department of Regulation

items.title: RBI receives highest complaints against private banks in FY25, annual ombudsman report shows
items.summary: Overall, under the RB-IOS, 13.34 lakh complaints were received in FY25 versus 11.75 lakh in previous fiscal.

items.title: Coal India reports 1.2% increase in production in November at 68 mt
items.summary: However, in April-November, 2025, Coal India’s cumulative output witnessed a 3.7 per cent y-o-y fall to 453.5 million tonnes (mt) compared to 471 mt in the corresponding period of the last financial year

items.title: Gold gains ₹2,200 per 10 grams on firm global trend

items.title: Railways records 4.2% higher freight loading in November 2025
items.summary: Indian Railways achieved record freight loading and earnings in November 2025.  Freight volume rose 4.2 percent year-on-year, with earnings reaching an all-time high.  Passenger numbers also saw a significant increase.  This performance reflects strong demand and improved operational efficiency.  The transporter surpassed the one-billion-tonne freight loading milestone.  Key commodities like coal and iron ore contributed substantially to this success.

items.title: NCLT allows IL&FS to revise terms in BKC headquarter sale deal with Brookfield affiliate
items.summary: NCLT upheld IL&amp;FS's decision to increase the sale value of TIFC to  ₹1,481 crore, rejecting Chronos Properties' challenge. The tribunal affirmed a binding contract while allowing IL&amp;FS to amend terms within the context of its debt resolution strategy.

items.title: Share of term deposits contracted above 7% falls sharply to 54% in Sept vs 73% in March, shows RBI data
items.summary: Interest rates on term deposits above 7% significantly dropped to 54% by September, reflecting the RBI's policy rate cuts. Loans linked to external benchmarks also saw immediate rate reductions. Public sector banks' deposit share increased, while Maharashtra led in deposit mobilization.

items.title: India-Canada trade pact: Negotiations likely to begin afresh as agenda more ambitious
items.summary: The two are now eyeing a comprehensive pact as opposed to an interim deal when talks were suspended in September 2023

items.title: No proposal on merger or consolidation of banks before govt presently: MoS Finance
items.summary: The government has stated that no proposals for merging or consolidating state-owned banks are currently being considered.  Foreign Direct Investment limits for public and private sector banks remain at 20 percent and 74 percent respectively.  Disinvestment of IDBI Bank will proceed as approved by the CCEA.  Regional Rural Banks have shown improved financial health, posting significant profits.

items.title: NCLT dismisses Brookfield’s ₹1,080 crore bid to acquire IL&FS Mumbai HQ
items.summary: A spokesperson from Brookfield said that contrary to the argument by ILFS, NCLT has found that the LoI is a concluded contract between the parties. For the dispute over IL&FS unilaterally changing purchase consideration, it intends to pursue remedies including appellate avenues.

items.summary: Will bring in greater efficiency and reliability in transmission of aeronautical messages such as flight plans and weather reports

items.summary: Weak financial inflows and a drop in reserves contributed to the steep rise in the Q2 current account gap

items.title: USFDA accepts Wockhardt’s NDA for breakthrough antibiotic Zaynich
items.summary: This is the first time ever that an NDA from a new chemical entity (NCE) from an Indian pharma company has been filed and accepted by the USFDA. The NDA was originally filed on September 30.

items.title: SEBI approves ₹10,000 crore IPO of ICICI Prudential AMC

items.title: All probable causes leading to Air India plane crash being investigated: Govt
items.summary: The Civil Aviation Ministry is investigating all possible reasons for the Air India plane crash. A preliminary report has been released with factual findings. The probe is ongoing to determine the accident's causes. Compensation is being processed for victims and their families. Air India flight AI171 crashed in Ahmedabad, resulting in significant loss of life.

items.title: India's FDI inflow rise 18% to USD 35.18 bn in Apr-Sep; inflows from US double
items.summary: India's Foreign Direct Investment surged over 18% to $35.18 billion in the first half of the fiscal year, with US inflows more than doubling. The services sector, particularly financial and business services, attracted the largest share of FDI equity. Maharashtra led Indian states in FDI equity inflow, followed by Karnataka and Gujarat.

items.title: Budget 2026: PHDCCI presents pre-budget suggestions to Finance Minister Sitharaman for MSME sector
items.summary: PHDCCI has presented pre-budget suggestions to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for the MSME sector. The proposals focus on easier taxes, cheaper credit, and simpler rules. These measures aim to reduce costs and delays for small businesses. The chamber seeks income tax exemption on capital gains invested in MSMEs.

items.title: Sun Pharma launches Ilumya for psoriasis treatment in India
items.summary: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries has launched its innovative drug Ilumya in India. This medication treats moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis. Clinical studies in India showed significant skin clearance in patients. Ilumya offers a new treatment option for those struggling with this condition. The drug has already been available in 35 countries.

items.summary: Aakash Educational Services's  ₹250-crore rights issue faces legal challenges, particularly regarding funds from Byju’s parent company. With top executives exiting and ongoing insolvency proceedings, the situation complicates Aakash’s capital-raising efforts.

Other major automakers like Tata Motors and Mahindra & Mahindra also saw significant increases. Two-wheeler and commercial vehicle segments also experienced robust growth. items.summary: Akasa Air has achieved a significant milestone by receiving IATA's Operational Safety Audit registration.
